title: fmt documentation: "%b" included as a valid verb for complex values.
body:
by **rnd0x00**: 
What steps will reproduce the problem?

The current documentation of valid verbs for format strings states:
" Floating-point and complex constituents:

%b	decimalless scientific notation with exponent a power of two,
	in the manner of strconv.FormatFloat with the 'b' format,
	e.g. -123456p-78"

However "%b" isn't a valid verb for complex values.
This is illustrated in: http://play.golang.org/p/2KQaVIcq4j
which produces the following output: "%!b(complex128=(1+2i))"

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
6g

Which operating system are you using?
linux

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
go version devel +a6d1a3f0411a Sat Sep 14 09:30:36 2013 +0200 linux/amd64
